availableEntities: Civil conflicts with foreign state intervention

note: Conflicts are included if fighting in them caused at least 25 military and civilian deaths in a year.
title: Non-state and state-based conflicts
subtitle: State-based conflicts are between states, or a state and a non-state armed group. Non-state conflicts are between non-state armed groups. One-sided violence involves an armed group and civilians.

relatedQuestions.text: Counting world conflict deaths: why do sources differ?
